content: Dentists in Central Coast We offer our patients exceptional service using the most advanced treatment and technology available. 4.8 Google review Book now Patient Stories Practitioners Our Closest Clinic See below for the closest dental clinic we have to this area—making it simple for you to book an appointment nearby.Mingara Dental & Implant Centre Office Hours Mon 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Tue 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Wed 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Thu 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Fri 8:00 am - 5:00 pm Sat 8:00 am - 2:00 pm Industry-Leading Dentist on the Central Coast Visiting the dentist regularly is an important step in caring for your dental health. Routine check-ups and professional teeth cleaning perfectly complement your daily brushing and flossing. Additionally, dentists at Smile On Clinics are committed to your comprehensive dental care. During your routine appointments, our industry-leading team use the latest technological developments to assist in the detection of emerging tooth or gum concerns. By identifying these issues early, we can tackle them before they become an overwhelming problem. We adopt the patient-first approach, giving you the information you need to stay informed of any potential dental treatments that our dentists may recommend. So, if you’re looking for a dental clinic on the Central Coast, then look no further, we are here to help with all your dental needs. Here at Smile On Clinics, we prioritise positive experiences, providing exceptional dental care to patients across Australia every day. Services You Can Access at Our Dentist In Central Coast Regular visits to your dentist are recommended to maintain your oral health. However, problems can - and do – develop, so it may be that you need specialised services to prevent further oral deterioration and to reverse the signs of damage. Poor oral health can impact quality of life in a variety of ways. Some patients find that they’ve lost their confidence, while others have reported feelings of self-consciousness when they smile. If you want to make a positive change to the health of your teeth and gums, there are many dental treatments available. And if you have avoided your local Central Coast dental clinic due to dentist anxiety, then you’ll be pleased to know that we are licensed to offer full sedation to Central Coast residents during their dental work. This is a game-changer for many who have neglected dental pain or who have lived with problems that impact their quality of life, due to dental anxiety. This is a common concern for many, and that’s why we’re pleased to offer this service at our Central Coast dental practice. Rather than specialising in one specific dental treatment, Smile On Clinics offers multiple dental services under one roof. From general dentistry, such as check-ups, to crafting bespoke dental implants in our own Smile On Labs, we take pride in providing exceptional dental care from the simplest to the most complex of dental treatment plans. Family-Friendly Orthodontist in Central Coast Teaching children how to care for their teeth is crucial so that they learn independent oral health care practices that will benefit them throughout their lives. Many children have a sweet tooth, and whether that’s candy or fruits, sugar is a major contributor to the formation of cavities. We understand that, in practice, it’s difficult to avoid all substances that can impact the health of teeth, so that’s why we advocate for all children to feel safe and comfortable at their dental appointments. If your child requires a bespoke dental care plan, our Central Coast family dentist offers cavity-filling services, such as fillings, to intervene in the deterioration of the tooth, helping to prevent further damage occurring in the weekend areas. If the tooth has been seriously damaged, you could opt to have a crown fitted too. As our children grow, adult teeth don’t always set in perfectly. To help align teeth that may be causing your teen concern, we can also offer to fit braces (which are aesthetically distant from the stereotypical “look”). Additionally, we are proud to offer Smile On Straighter, the clear dental aligners that are almost invisible at first glance. We can help you and your family choose the best option for your circumstances. Clear aligners are an incredibly popular option at our dental clinic because it combines a cosmetic enhancement without the permanent application (and maintenance) of braces. Bespoke Dental Implants Crafted in Our Smile On Lab Losing teeth, no matter the reason, can be a knock to the confidence, with some patients reporting that they avoid smiling in social situations due to embarrassment. Smiling is a human instinct, and we’re here to provide quality dental care to suit your dental needs. Using the latest technology, we are able to offer our exclusive Teeth On Implants, which replicate your teeth to rebuild a natural and beautiful smile. We meticulously photograph and x-ray your mouth to ensure that we have all the exact measurements, including your face shape and smile line, to carefully craft your replacement teeth. They match so closely that no one will guess that you’re sporting implants! Teeth On Implants are particularly well suited if you have broken or chipped teeth, or even if you have a tooth loss. During our analysis, we’ll share all our data with you, including the photos and x-rays, so you can make an informed choice about your dental treatment plan. Our quality dental care doesn’t stop there, you can also make use of our Smile On Digital Smile Design technology. This innovative application allows you to ‘try out’ different smiles before you commit to a specific care and treatment plan. Rather than relying on a dentist’s impressions of how you should look, our team at Smile On Clinics put you in control. Simply use the functions to try different smiles against your picture to find the aesthetic look that boosts your confidence. Your dentist will be available to offer guidance and support throughout the whole process, providing exceptional dental care that you can trust. Choosing Smile On Clinics For Your Dental Needs Alongside cosmetic dentistry and general maintenance services, you can also access top-quality care during a dental emergency. Sudden onset of unexplained pain, injury, or even urgent need for wisdom tooth removal – our dentists are here to help. Whether for a child or an adult, please call us to book an appointment as soon as possible. Even if the injury or damage may not seem severe in the first instance, there is potential for complications to develop if left untreated for too long. Whether you’re looking for an experienced dentist who offers the benefits of the latest technological developments to maintain your oral health, or whether you desire cosmetic enhancements to improve your quality of life, while restoring your amazing smile – you can rely on Smile on Clinics to give you the very best care available. Call us or reach us through our easy-to-use contact form to discuss your dental needs and book your initial assessment. At Smile On Clinics, your trusted Charmhaven dentist will utilise our state-of-the-art technology to take photographs and X-rays that inform your care plan, while we ensure that we share all the information gathered so you can make a fully informed choice about your oral health going forward. Do You Require Dental Implants or Dentures? Our specialised team are experienced in helping adults to improve their dental health by crafting implants and dentures specifically designed to suit their dental needs. Implants are particularly suitable for cases where the tooth is chipped, cracked, or otherwise damaged to the point that it is more economical to replace than to rebuild the tooth itself. Though this may sound intimidating, we’ve created a smooth process from start to finish that lets you stay in control. Our dentists care about getting you the results you desire, that’s why we ensure we take all the measurements, down to the tiniest detail, so that we can keep your teeth looking natural, and virtually indistinguishable - no matter if we’re custom designing full mouth implants or if matching to the surrounding teeth. Straighten Crooked Teeth with The Charmhaven Dental Clinic Though crooked teeth are incredibly common, it can still have an impact on your self-confidence and quality of life. However, there are routine dental treatments available to help you boost your smile power. The most traditional route to straighter teeth is by applying braces. These are a permanent fixture, requiring regular adjustments by your dentist in Charmhaven. Braces have advanced in recent years, and are no longer the bulky, inconvenient stereotype. However, if you’re choosing braces, it’s worthwhile to research the pros and cons. While some prefer that the braces be affixed, reducing their overall maintenance, they can cause some pressure and may cause some gum irritation, too. In other cases, it may be necessary to apply other treatments, particularly if there is more damage than a sealant can handle. In these instances, you may be offered fillings (with a choice of materials available), crowns, or bridges as necessary. Which Health Funds Can You Use? Preventative dental care aims to maintain a healthy oral environment by tackling emerging issues before they develop into larger concerns. What Are Restorative Treatments for Damaged Teeth? Teeth can easily become damaged through injury, accident, or poor hygiene practices. However, cavities and cracks can be repaired through restorative treatments. At our dentist in Chisholm, you can access multiple treatment options including: Fillings for Cavities: These are perfect solutions for small areas of decay in your teeth that may be causing you issues. By applying a filling, you’ll prevent these holes from becoming larger and leading to further complications. Fillings are available in the same colour as your natural teeth, meaning the dental work isn’t as easily detected in conversation with others. Root Canal Therapy: Teeth that are infected in the centre can be particularly painful – during a root canal, the inside of the tooth is removed, with as much of the exterior structure preserved as possible. Dental Crowns and Bridges: Damaged teeth, particularly those in the front of your mouth, can lead to self-consciousness. These restorative dental treatments boost your oral health by preventing further damage from developing and potentially improving how you feel about your smile. Tooth Extractions: When necessary, we perform gentle extractions, including wisdom tooth removal, with options for sedation if necessary to ensure your comfort throughout the procedure. Advanced Dental Implant Solutions Our specialised team excels in creating custom dental implants for patients with missing teeth. These permanent replacements look and function like natural teeth, preserving jaw structure and restoring confidence. During your assessment for dental implants, your trusted Chisholm dentist will take extensive measurements and use colour matching technology to craft a perfect fit within our Smile On Labs. Each implant is custom-made, ensuring that it fits the gap comfortably and securely, is matched to your face shape and smile line, while perfect tone matching ensures that the new implant looks indistinguishable from your natural teeth. As part of your comprehensive dental care, we’ll also provide you with information on how to care for your implant so that it lasts a long time. Losing a tooth can be a difficult situation to adjust to, but Smile On Clinics will help restore your natural smile for a seamless finish. Complete Orthodontic Services for Chisholm Residents Misaligned, or crooked, teeth are very common. But if you dream of a row of straight pearly whites, then you have several options available to you. Traditional Braces: These come in several material types, and designs have been improved in recent years to increase comfort and effectiveness. These are a permanent attachment to the teeth and will require regular dentist visits for adjustment as your teeth move into their desired position. Smile On Straighter Clear Aligners: These are a non-permanent alternative to traditional braces and feature a clear aligner used for the majority of the day. However, it is possible to remove for short periods (particularly when eating or for cleaning). Early Intervention Orthodontics: For younger patients, we offer palatal expanders and space maintainers to guide proper jaw development, assessed and fitted by your Chisholm family dentist. Jaw Alignment Treatments: We address functional issues like overbites, underbites, and crossbites to improve both appearance and oral function. If you’re curious about how your appearance will change with the use of these appliances, you can now use our Digital Smile app to view potential results before any treatment has even started. This app gives you control over your final appearance, rather than allowing your dentist to do that for you. You will, however, be given guidance and support wherever necessary to ensure you get the best treatment to deliver the results you desire. Emergency Dental Care When You Need It Dental emergencies require prompt attention. Your dental practice may offer urgent appointments for: Severe toothaches Broken or cracked teeth Sudden tooth loss Gum damage Problems arising from previous dental work Quick intervention often means the difference between saving and losing a tooth during a dental emergency, so it’s best to reach out asap before additional problems develop that may require a more intense solution. Whether you're seeking routine maintenance or a complete smile transformation, our team is dedicated to providing exceptional care in a comfortable environment. Personalised Dental Care That Puts You First What sets our dental clinic near Concord apart is our commitment to patient-centred care. We understand that every smile is unique, and so are your dental needs. Our multi-specialist team takes the time to listen to your concerns, answer your questions, and develop customised dental treatment plans that align with your goals and preferences. Using innovative Smile Digital Design technology, we can show you how various treatments will transform your appearance before you commit. This visual preview helps you make confident decisions about your dental health while ensuring the results meet your expectations. Comprehensive Dental Services Under One Roof Preventative care measures are necessary to ensure a strong foundation in your dental health. Brushing and flossing are two measures you can take at home, but regular visits to your dentist for check-ups and professional cleanings are also important. During your visits to our dentist near Concord, you’ll receive thorough examinations that go beyond simply looking for cavities. Our comprehensive dental care assessments include: Professional cleaning to remove plaque and tartar Digital X-rays to detect hidden problems Oral cancer screenings Gum disease evaluation Assessment of existing restorations By identifying potential issues early, we can often provide conservative treatments for Concord residents that preserve more of the natural tooth structure, while helping to avoid costly procedures down the road. Restorative Dentistry: Rebuilding Function and Confidence with Trusted Concord Dentist When damage occurs, our restorative treatments repair teeth while maintaining natural aesthetics. Our Concord dental clinic offers multiple solutions depending on the type of restoration your tooth issue requires. If you have a cavity, we can seal the area with tooth-coloured sealant, which helps to prevent further decay while maintaining the integrity of your tooth structure. In cases of damaged or missing teeth, it can be a knock to your confidence whenever you smile (or even while speaking). Rather than go through life with this self-conscious concern, your trusted Concord dentist can help by offering bridges, crowns, veneers, or even a full mouth of implants. We’ll discuss these options with you so that you can make a fully informed decision before treatment commences. Dental pain can have an extreme effect on your day, and an infected tooth is right up there on the pain scale. If you have this, then we would recommend that you undergo a root canal treatment. Although this can be nerve-wracking, we can offer sedation if you believe the procedure will cause undue stress or discomfort. Our trusted Concord dentist will do all they can to ensure that the external structure of your tooth remains intact so that you don’t need a dental implant or other replacement. Looking For a Dentist in Concord to Replace a Missing Tooth? Tooth loss can significantly impact your confidence and oral function. Our dental implant services provide permanent, custom designed, natural-looking replacements that function exactly like natural teeth, so you can continue to speak and eat as you usually would. Replacing a missing tooth can also help preserve or restore your facial contours, and best of all, they don’t require any additional maintenance beyond the usual brushing and flossing required for the good health of your natural teeth. Our Concord dental implant specialists guide you through the entire process, from initial consultation to final restoration, ensuring predictable results and a comfortable experience. You can also view possible smile matches on our Digital Smile app, allowing you to see the potential results before any work has even started. Advanced Orthodontic Options for All Ages at Your Family Dentist near Concord Misaligned teeth affect more than just appearance—they can impact speech, chewing ability, and long-term dental health. Our Concord dental practice offers multiple orthodontic solutions, including traditional (permanent) braces, and clear aligners/Invisalign (removable for brief periods). These dental services are available to Concord residents of all ages. However, we would first need to do an extensive assessment before making a recommendation for this course of treatment. Particularly young children (below teens) may be advised to avoid treatment unless absolutely necessary, as they are still growing. Teens and adults may benefit more often from the comprehensive dental care our orthodontist offers, particularly in cases where teeth alignment is proving to be a concern. However, there may be cases where early intervention is the best course to reduce the potential for more expensive interventions later. If you’re uncertain, please speak with your dentist in Concord to find out more information about your unique circumstances and the action that they would recommend. Cosmetic Dentistry for Concord Residents Cosmetic dentistry refers to those procedures and treatments that are not essential for good oral health, but would enhance your confidence or give your self-image a boost. Aesthetic treatments show that you take good care of yourself and want to make your appearance more closely match your idea of aesthetically pleasing. Treatments covered in this include professional whitening services, porcelain veneers applied over your natural teeth, or dental bonding to fix small chips or cracks that you don’t like and no longer wish to see. The Concord dental practice team combines technical skill with an artistic eye to create results that enhance your natural features while looking authentically yours. Here at Smile On Clinics, we believe that a healthy and confident smile is the key to happiness and well-being. Here we will list just a few reasons why you shouldn’t skip your routine appointments: Prevents tooth decayRegular checks and cleaning ensure the removal of plaque and tartar buildup. Protects against gum diseaseEarly detection and treatment can help prevent any serious gum issues. Screening for more serious issuesForster dental experts will check for any signs of potential serious concerns, such as oral cancer. Improves overall healthHeart disease, diabetes and other conditions are linked to poor oral health. Preserves natural teethPreventative care helps to maintain strong, clean teeth and reduces the risk of tooth loss. Saves you moneyVisiting a dental practice often means that we can intervene with any issues early on. This prevents extensive treatments that can be uncomfortable and costly. Boosts confidenceHaving a wonderful, healthy smile enhances your self-esteem and overall well-being. Our welcoming staff will explain in easy-to-understand terms about the appointment and how to take care of their dental needs effectively. title: Dentist in Griffith | Professional Dental Care You Can Trust
content: 2 Palla StreetGriffith NSW 2680 (02) 6964 1888 griffith@smileon.com.au www.smileongriffith.com.au facebook.com/smileonclinics instagram.com/smileonclinics If you are looking for a local dental practice which offers high quality dental treatment services and are the experts in dental implantology and cosmetic dentistry treatments, then Smile on Griffith is the ideal solution. Conveniently located at 2 Palla St, Griffith NSW 2680, Smile on Griffith (previously known as Riverina Smiles) is here to bring the best in dental care to Griffith and the surrounding region. Opening Hours Monday: 9am – 5pm Tuesday: 9am – 5pm Wednesday: 9am – 5pm Thursday: 9am – 5pm Friday: 9am – 4pm Saturday: CLOSED Sunday: CLOSED Please note that while we endeavour to be open as much as possible during busy periods our office hours may vary on public holidays. If you have any questions about our opening hours please contact our team. Looking for a Dentist in Griffith? If you’re looking for a dental practice in Griffith, you’ve come to the right place. Smile On Clinics is a local leader in both general dentistry and cosmetic treatments. From checkups to crowns, and cleanings to clear aligners, our experts have the skills and cutting-edge technology to make your next trip to a dentist in Griffith smooth and comfortable. Find a Qualified Orthodontist in Griffith Our dental clinics offer all common dental treatments designed to keep your smile white and healthy. Explore our range of treatment options below: General dental check-ups and cleanings Are you seeking a standard dental checkup? That’s no problem, and we’ll use the most advanced technology to assess your dental hygiene comprehensively and provide exceptional dental care. We also offer cleanings, which are designed to remove bacteria, plaque and tartar buildup from the surfaces of your teeth. It is recommended that you complete a teeth cleaning every six months for the best smile. Our general dentistry services also cover other services, such as crowns, veneers and implants. If you’re looking for a Griffith family dentist, Smile On Clinic’s range of generalist treatments ensures we can keep your family’s smiles in tip-top condition. Fillings for cavities Did you know that over 3/4 of the Australian population has had at least one filling? Our dentists can help install the filling type of your choice, aiming for a pain-free procedure. Teeth whitening If you’re looking to brighten your smile, we offer safe, effective teeth whitening. Using the most cutting-edge whitening methods, we restore unsightly stains to bright, clean tooth surfaces. Root canal therapy Root canal therapy is a highly effective dental treatment designed to save damaged or infected teeth, relieve pain and restore your natural smile. By gently removing the infection inside the tooth and sealing it, a root canal therapy procedure helps you avoid extractions, returning you to eating, speaking and smiling confidently. Tooth extractions Tooth extractions are a safe and routine procedure to remove damaged, decayed or problematic teeth, preserving your dental health in the long term. For example, a tooth extraction may be required if there’s a troublesome wisdom tooth removal. A tooth extraction will help relieve discomfort and pave the way for long-term solutions like dental implants or restorative treatments. Our tooth extractions are conducted using the best practices and technologies. Dental crowns and bridges Dental crowns are custom-made restorations designed to strengthen damaged or weakened teeth. As well as protecting damaged teeth, dental crowns will restore their natural look and function. Whether you need to repair a cracked tooth or complete a root canal treatment, crowns offer long-lasting protection and an effortlessly confident smile. Dental bridges fulfil a similar function. By filling gaps to restore your bite and enhance your appearance, dental bridges effectively substitute one or more missing teeth. Overall, bridges help you chew, speak and smile comfortably – without compromising your teeth’s natural appearance. Braces (metal, ceramic, lingual) Braces don’t have to be a source of embarrassment – find the braces that work for you with our range of options. When you chat to our dentists about orthodontic treatments they’ll help you find the right braces to serve you – and your smile. Smile On Straighter (clear aligners) Smile On Straighter Clear Aligners are a game-changing corrective treatment designed to move your teeth’s position comfortably. By gradually moving your teeth using a series of clear aligners, you can experience your straightest possible smile. The clear appearance reduces the aligners’ visibility for the most natural possible appearance. Retainers (post-treatment maintenance) After corrective orthodontics, consider maintaining your natural smile through custom-made retainers. These retainers will fit snugly around your teeth, preventing natural reversion towards their original position. Palatal expanders Palatal expanders are a staple of orthodontics. Designed to widen the upper arch, they’ll gently address overcrowding and crossbite. Jaw alignment treatments They’re just as they sound – jaw alignment treatments will use various implements (e.g. braces) to correct the jaw gently. Benefits of a corrected jaw include improved chewing, swallowing and breathing and improved function of the teeth. Early intervention orthodontics Whatever your requirements, Smile On Clinics has got you covered – and that includes dental needs like early intervention orthodontics (sometimes referred to as interceptive orthodontics). Early intervention orthodontics is an orthopaedic approach that ensures that the teeth and jaws develop correctly in children. Comprehensive oral exams Looking to understand your oral health in full? Smile On Clinics’ comprehensive dental care will ensure that you can make informed decisions about your dental health. Preventative dental care (cleanings, sealants) Effective preventative care will prevent the need for dental surgery – implants, extractions and so forth. Sealants will coat the surface of a vulnerable tooth, preventing further decay. Restorative services (fillings, crowns, bridges) Restorative services are essential in dentistry, and you should expect your local dental practice to provide all the basics – fillings, crowns and bridges. Cosmetic dentistry (veneers, whitening, bonding) Our Griffith dental clinic also offers a range of cosmetic dentistry treatments. For example, if you’re looking for high-quality veneers, we’re happy to assist. Orthodontic treatments (braces, aligners) Hundreds of thousands of Australians get braces, and once the braces have successfully realigned the teeth, we’ll fashion aligners to keep them in place. Emergency dental care (toothache, trauma repair) A dental emergency can be a source of intense anxiety. However, our expert approach will provide peace of mind when dealing with an out-of-hours emergency. It’s part of our commitment to serving local families – emergencies don’t always come at convenient times, and we’ve adjusted our availability to match. Discover More About Smile On’s Griffith Dental Clinic What makes Smile On Clinics a top choice for Griffith dental clinics? Firstly, our dental services are designed to put you first, aiming for a best-in-class customer experience. Our quality dental care extends to before, after and during treatment. We’ll meet all your dental needs, aiming to give you a five-star dental experience. We cater to all Griffith residents, making us a convenient choice. To consult with one of our trusted Griffith dentists, book a consultation today. Smile On Clinics has established a stellar local reputation for exceptional dental care. Whether you're experiencing a dental emergency or looking for comprehensive dental care, we've got you covered. What Treatments Does Our Dental Practice Offer? Ideally, a family dentist should provide a range of dental treatments to cater for all oral health requirements. Let's break down a sample of the dental services that Smile On Clinics offers. General dental check-ups and cleanings If you're looking for a dentist near Huskisson who can fulfil the 'bread and butter' functions of comprehensive dental care - i.e. check-ups and simple cleans - then Smile On Clinics could be a good fit. We're focused on providing exceptional dental care at every level - regardless of whether you're looking for specialist cosmetic dentistry or just a simple scaling treatment, Smile On Clinics can exceed your expectations for all of your dental needs. Fillings for cavities High-quality dental care also includes reactive treatments like fillings for cavities. Fillings restore the teeth's appearance and functionality while protecting them from further decay. Teeth whitening Smile On Clinics can assist with cosmetic treatments like teeth whitening - if you're seeking a dental clinic catering to more than just general check-ups. Using enamel-safe teeth whitening techniques, we'll unlock your teeth's potential and show them off to their best effect. Root canal therapy In rare cases, a dentist might assess your oral health and decide that root canal therapy might be the best course of action. Root canal therapy cleans infected pulp from within a tooth and reseals it to prevent further infection. Tooth extractions If a tooth is damaged or in the wrong position, an extraction may be necessary. Smile On Clinics aims for a painless procedure, ensuring the best possible outcome. A dental extraction can then be followed by a dental implant, which replaces a missing tooth with a synthetic (yet natural-looking) substitute that is firmly stationed through titanium screws. Dental crowns and bridges Dental crowns and bridges are common procedures designed to alleviate teeth's natural wear and tear. A dental crown is a cap that's placed over the tooth and protects it from erosion. A dental bridge is a solid structure that replaces a missing tooth. Braces (metal, ceramic, lingual) Hundreds of thousands of Australians have worn braces. Whether it's metal or ceramic braces or a lingual brace (also known as a 'hidden brace', as it nestles on the inside of the teeth), Smile On Clinics can provide you with the braces you need to quickly align your teeth into the desired position. Smile On Straighter (clear aligners) Likewise, Smile On Straighter Clear Aligners are a tried-and-tested approach for naturally shifting your teeth into a straighter and more even appearance. Clear aligners move your teeth gradually, and its clear appearance is inconspicuous. Retainers (post-treatment maintenance) What are you going to do after treatment to maintain your teeth's optimal position? Well, retainers, as their name suggests, keep your teeth in place, fitting snugly around your teeth. Palatal expanders Another orthodontic staple, palatal expanders open the upper arch, preventing overcrowding. If you think you might need palatal expanders, consult with your dentist. Jaw alignment treatments Jaw alignment treatments encapsulate a number of orthodontic treatments designed to improve the position of your jaw. A better-aligned jaw will help with activities like swallowing, eating and breathing, as well as relieving discomfort. Early intervention orthodontics Quality dental care doesn't start at any particular age - and early intervention orthodontics is the proof. They're designed to ensure that your child's mouth and jaw develop healthily, hopefully leading to good orthodontic and dental health in adolescence and adulthood. Comprehensive oral exams A comprehensive oral exam will imbue you with a complete understanding of your oral health and the steps you can take to improve it. Preventative dental care (cleanings, sealants) They say prevention is better than a cure, and this principle certainly applies to dentistry. The best dentists will be focused on being proactive rather than reactive. Accordingly, they should offer teeth cleaning services and sealants (sealants are coatings for your back teeth, which slow down erosion). Restorative services (fillings, crowns, bridges) Smile On Clinics’ restorative dental services - including fillings, crowns, and bridges - are designed to repair and strengthen damaged teeth. These restorative services will improve the appearance and function of weakened teeth. Whether you need a simple filling to treat a cavity, a crown to protect a weakened tooth, or a bridge to replace missing teeth, we can explore tailored solutions with you. Our goal? To help you regain a healthy, confident smile. Our advanced, industry-leading materials and techniques ensure durable, natural-looking results that let you eat, speak and - most importantly - smile with ease. Cosmetic dentistry (veneers, whitening, bonding) Our dental practice also offers cosmetic dentistry so you can achieve your dream smile. Whether you're seeking porcelain veneers or you're looking for a specialist whitening treatment, we've got you covered. Orthodontic treatments (braces, aligners) Braces and aligners are both classic examples of orthodontic treatments that can fix your teeth's alignment (as well as straighten their appearance). If you think your teeth's positioning could benefit from braces or aligners, please reach out to your local dentist clinic. Emergency dental care (toothache, trauma repair) Rarely, individuals may experience a dental emergency, such as wisdom tooth removal, that necessitates emergency dental care. Tooth-related emergencies can cause extreme discomfort, and it is essential to find a local dentist who can provide out-of-hours services. Get in Touch with a Trusted Dentist We cater to all Huskisson residents, so whatever dental services you're looking for, we'll meet all your dental needs. Our friendly, local dental clinic will ensure your teeth are kept in tip-top shape. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to reach out to our friendly customer support team, who will be happy to assist with your query. The quality care you deserve, delivered with a personal touch Smile On Clinics comprises of a network of premium dental practices located across the Central Coast, the Hunter Valley region and Sydney. Our Use of Technology Our dental team wants to ensure you have the best experience possible when you are here at our dental surgery, and technology is one way we can provide that. Dental technology not only means our dentists can make earlier, more accurate diagnoses, but often, treatment is less invasive as well. This often translates to less time in the dental chair for our patients. REQUEST AN APPOINTMENT WITH US We can't wait to see you at the clinic. New patients feel free to choose a time that suits you online, while existing patients, please call to fast-track your next appointment. NEW PATIENTS BOOK HERE Featured Services Dental Implants Replace missing teeth with durable, natural-looking dental implants that restore functionality and aesthetics. Teeth Whitening Brighten your smile with our professional teeth whitening services for a radiant, confident look. Cosmetic Dentistry Enhance your smile with cosmetic treatments designed to improve your teeth’s appearance and boost confidence. Veneers Correct imperfections and achieve a flawless smile with custom-made veneers. Dental Crowns Restore and protect damaged teeth with high-quality dental crowns tailored to your needs. Teeth Straightening Achieve a beautifully aligned smile with our teeth straightening solutions, including braces and Invisalign. Dentures Replace multiple missing teeth with full or partial dentures, designed for comfort and functionality. Orthodontist for Kids Provide your child with expert orthodontic care for a healthy and properly aligned smile. Dental Chip Repair Quickly repair chipped teeth and restore your smile’s natural beauty and function. Our Team Meet the dedicated professionals behind our practice. Our team of skilled dentists and specialists is committed to delivering exceptional care and ensuring every patient feels comfortable and confident in their smile. With a wealth of experience and a passion for excellence, each team member plays a vital role in making your dental journey a positive one.
